body: Hi. What about this? Do you have an opinion about my suggestion?

Sorry for the delayed response on this, Philip. I agree that there's not a compelling reason to throw here, and we should instead truncate + issue a warning.

If you are still interested in contributing this, I would be happy to review the PR.
@AveshCSingh: I am trying to get started in OSS contributions for mlflow wonder if a can try to tackle this one with some mentorship from the community.
Hi @nlauchande, that sounds wonderful. Thank you! Feel free to ping me on the OSS Slack channel if you have any questions or would like to bounce ideas off of someone.

@AveshCSingh : My current idea is to truncate the value ( up to 5000 characters) at this point  :  https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/3936705d9a41ada8e526c7981bb0a119862d53c3/mlflow/store/model_registry/sqlalchemy_store.py#L526 - > Do you think it will work correctly . Pre-validation . Updating the tag value, to the truncate value. Working on a PR with this approach , still trying to find my way how to build in development model so i can test the fix.

@nlauchande , I'm sorry for the very late response. I lost track of this, but did have some time to discuss this with another committer.

Some proposals for the behavior:
(1) The truncation behavior should be controlled by a flag, to avoid breaking existing workflows that depend on intact tags. For some workflows, it is better to fail early than to write an incomplete tag.

(2) Related to (1), this truncation logic should not apply for [system tags](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/mlflow/utils/mlflow_tags.py). These have special purposes and truncating them could break invariants.

(3) We should issue a warning when a tag is truncated so the user's aware of this

Regarding the specific implementations: I think this should apply for all tags, not just model version tags. Based on the logic in `validation.py`, I believe the list of tag classes we have are:
- ExperimentTag
- RunTag
- RegisteredModelTag

I think we should have the same behavior for all of these flags. To do this, we should update the logic in our validation functions (`_validate_tag`, `_validate_experiment_tag`, `_validate_registered_model_tag`, `_validate_model_version_tag`) to truncate the tag value. To implement this, we might want to update these functions to take one of the above tag objects and update the `value` property. If we do that, we should also rename the functions to indicate that the input may be mutated, maybe something like `validate_and_fix`.
@AveshCSingh : Thanks for the help, looking at it now. Will start crafting my PR in the next few days . Will keep you udpated.
Hi, guys. If no one is working on it and the issue is still important. I would like to work on it.
That would be very nice. Thanks @ognis1205
